page.title: 03PINES CAFE, BROOMFIELD
page.content: The owner enjoys running the Pines cafe and restaurant with the help of three other women. The premises have been a place of eating for about 50 years; the present owner has been running it for seven. She gets most of her customers in the summer at weekends, especially Sundays when she may get up to 300 customers. In the winter she may get as few as two customers. Many older people out for a country drive call in. She thinks she does better in the hills than she would down in the village of Kingston St.Mary because she gets a lot of walkers, cyclists and coach parties. They open at 10.30 and close about 6 p.m. The gift shop next door is leased by the cafe owner.The gifts sold are not made locally.
